newsitem.title: USA: Pilots group in deal with Atlantic Coast.
newsitem.headline: Pilots group in deal with Atlantic Coast.

text.p: The Air Line Pilots Association said on Wednesday it reached a tentative agreement on a new three-year contract with Atlantic Coast Airlines Inc.
"We are pleased with the negotiations and with the results," said Jeff Brundage, chairman of the Atlantic Coast pilots' master executive council, an ALPA unit.
"This process has strengthened labor-management relations at Atlantic Coast," he said.

The agreement provides for more compensation and better work rules for the airline's 500 pilots, while giving the company the flexibility to respond to growth opportunities, Brundage said. No other details were provided on the pact.
Atlantic Coast confirmed it reached a tentative pact with the group and said it expected ratification around February 1.
It said the agreement provided for improved medical and 401K benefits, competitive pay rates and modified work rules. The contract was amendable as of March 31, 1996, it said.
